feed.title: ComicTagger Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for ComicTagger: 1.5.1: Trafalgar D. Water Law
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Fix CBL tagging fixes #376
  • Update the importlib_metadata minimum version fixes #375
  • Fix an issue when replacing invalid characters during renaming
  • Fixes a crash that could occur during renaming fixes #374
  • Add an additional syntax to file renaming

Full Changelog: https://github.com/comictagger/comictagger/compare/1.5.0...1.5.1

entry.title: New release for ComicTagger: 1.5.2: Elizabeth Anne "Liz" Sherman
New release for ComicTagger: 1.5.3: Walter Kovacs
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Fix an issue with retrieving alternate cover images
  • Currently there is still an issue when using using the search button, however the auto-identify and auto-tag features will work.
  • Uses latest PyInstaller to build packages, fixes a sorting issue on macOS

Full Changelog: https://github.com/comictagger/comictagger/compare/1.5.2...1.5.3

entry.title: New release for ComicTagger: 1.5.4: Asta
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Fix retrieving issues from cache when volume is incomplete

Full Changelog: https://github.com/comictagger/comictagger/compare/1.5.3...1.5.4

entry.title: New release for ComicTagger: 1.5.5: Scanlan Shorthalt
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Fix a crash when a comic does not have a url by @mizaki in #393
  • Update macOS packaging, .zip, .cbz, .rar, .cbr, .7z, .cb7 files should all allow opening in ComicTagger from Finder
  • 7zip support is now optional if installing via pip
  • The standard notes value is now appended to instead of overwriting existing data fixes #390
  • Update checking now works, disabled by default.

Settings will be changed in the next release

Currently the format used to store and retrieve settings has some downsides, primarily the format is not well defined and does not allow for more complex types. Consequently there is now a warning that you must silence 4 times if you want it to go away.

Because a new format is being used the settings will not be deleted so you can open up an old version and the new version at the same time in order to compare.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/comictagger/comictagger/compare/1.5.4...1.5.5
